column4: (i'll try this the n00b way) can someone help with an installation problem?:

gave out specifics 10 minutes ago :P in short ubiquity is saying i don't have a root partition selected when i do infact have one selected. apparently it wants the "reformat" box checked on whatever i pick as /. this is with 6.10
does that partition have wrong existing filesystem? ext3, reiser, resier4, xfs, jfs, ...?
it's ext3, clean, but it does have data i can't backup, so i can't reformat it
[i can't search because of the dns issue, i'm ssh'd into my router to use irc]
can you resolve launchpad.net for me?
grrr... does the livecd have the console installer on it?
all I can say is: good luck!
i make my own luck.... *grabs a rocket launcher* this is gonna be ugly.
we need heroes such as you and me to save the world *smirk*

Since you must reformat the root file system for use by the installer in any case, you can easily work around this problem by deleting and re-creating the partition in question in the advanced partitioner. what kind of crap is this?!
oh i assure you, i save the world from M$, one day at a time, one computer at a time....
